ml.alternet.misc

Interface Type

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Type

    public interface Type
extends Type
    Represent a Java type (a class name that doesn't necessarily exist), with special handling for primitives.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Type.Kind
      Kind of Java types.
      static class  Type.Parsed
      Parse a type definition ; may be an array, or a type parameter with optionally wildcard types with upper/lower bounds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Type asArrayType()
      Turn this type e.g a "java.time.LocalDate" to an array type, e.g "java.time.LocalDate[]".
      Type box()
      Return the counterpart boxed type of this type.
      default Optional<Class<?>> forName()
      Return the underlying class if this type corresponds to a class.
      Optional<Class<?>> getDeclaredClass()
      Return the wrapped class if this type was created from a class.

      Return the kind of this type.

      Return the package name of this Java class name.

      Get the qualified name of this Java class name.

      Return the simple name of this Java class name.

      Create a type from a class.

      Create a type from the qualified name of a class, that is to say the package name (if any) followed by the simple name of the class.

      Create a type from a package and a simple name.
      static Type of(Type type)
      Create a type from a type.
      default <T> T parse(String value)
      Parse a value to the underlying type (scalar type, enum value, or array of scalar type or enum).

      Parse a type definition ; may be an array, or a type parameter with optionally wildcard types with upper/lower bounds.

      Return a string representation of this type and its parameterized types if any.

      Return the counterpart unboxed type (a primitive) of this type.
      default Type withTypeParameters(Type... type)
      Turn this type e.g a "java.util.List" to a parameterized type, e.g "java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>".

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.reflect.Type

        getTypeName

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static Type of(String qualifiedName)
        Create a type from the qualified name of a class, that is to say the package name (if any) followed by the simple name of the class.
        Parameters:
        qualifiedName - The qualified name of a class.
        Returns:
        The actual type.

      • of

        static Type of(String pkg,
               String cl)
        Create a type from a package and a simple name.
        Parameters:
        pkg - The package name, or null.
        cl - The simple name of the class
        Returns:
        The actual type.

      • of

        static Type of(Class<?> clazz)
        Create a type from a class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class.
        Returns:
        The actual type.

      • of

        static Type of(Type type)
        Create a type from a type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type.
        Returns:
        The actual type.

      • parseTypeDefinition

        static Type parseTypeDefinition(String typeDefinition)
        Parse a type definition ; may be an array, or a type parameter with optionally wildcard types with upper/lower bounds.
        Parameters:
        typeDefinition - The actual type definition, e.g "org.acme.Foo<java.util.Map<?, ? super java.lang.Integer>,com.example.Bar[],java.lang.Appendable>"
        Returns:
        A type that can be a composed type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the type definition is malformed.

      • getKind

        Type.Kind getKind()
        Return the kind of this type.
        Returns:
        The kind of this type.

      • forName

        default Optional<Class<?>> forName()
        Return the underlying class if this type corresponds to a class.
        Returns:
        The underlying class if it exists.

      • getDeclaredClass

        Optional<Class<?>> getDeclaredClass()
        Return the wrapped class if this type was created from a class.
        Returns:
        The underlying class.

      • toString

        default String toString(Predicate<Type> omitPackage)
        Return a string representation of this type and its parameterized types if any.
        Parameters:
        omitPackage - Indicates for each type whether to return the simple name or the fully qualified name of the type ; typical use case is to omit the "java.lang" package or packages that are imported.
        Returns:
        The string representation of this type.

      • box

        Type box()
        Return the counterpart boxed type of this type.
        Returns:
        The boxed type if this type is a primitive type, this otherwise.

      • unbox

        Type unbox()
        Return the counterpart unboxed type (a primitive) of this type.
        Returns:
        The unboxed type if this type is a boxed type, this otherwise.

      • getQualifiedName

        default String getQualifiedName()
        Get the qualified name of this Java class name.
        Returns:
        The package name (if any) followed by the simple name of the class.

      • getSimpleName

        String getSimpleName()
        Return the simple name of this Java class name.
        Returns:
        This simple name.

      • getPackageName

        String getPackageName()
        Return the package name of this Java class name.
        Returns:
        This package name, or null if this type is not in a package.

      • withTypeParameters

        default Type withTypeParameters(Type... type)
        Turn this type e.g a "java.util.List" to a parameterized type, e.g "java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>".
        Parameters:
        type - The type parameters ; primitives are boxed automatically, e.g an "int" will be boxed to "java.lang.Integer".
        Returns:
        The new type with its parameters.
        See Also:
        ParameterizedType

      • asArrayType

        default Type asArrayType()
        Turn this type e.g a "java.time.LocalDate" to an array type, e.g "java.time.LocalDate[]".
        Returns:
        The new type, as an array type.
        See Also:
        GenericArrayType

      • parse

        default <T> T parse(String value)
        Parse a value to the underlying type (scalar type, enum value, or array of scalar type or enum).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the expected type.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to transform. If the result type is an array, the values are separated by a comma, and whitespaces around are ignored.
        Returns:
        The value in the expected type.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - For number types, if the string does not contain a parsable byte.
        IllegalArgumentException - For enum types with wrong values.
        UnsupportedOperationException - If the type is neither a scalar type nor an enum type.
